definition: Cai Lun (-121), the inventor of the papermaking process

sentences.english: Cai Lungs new technique spread quickly, and he was recognized by the later generations as the inventor of paper.
sentences.chinese: 蔡伦的新技术迅速传开，他被后世认为是纸的发明者。

sentences.english: It is widely accepted that paper was invented by Cai Lun in the Eastern.
sentences.chinese: 普遍认为纸由蔡伦在东汉时期发明。

sentences.english: He made great contribution to humankind for his invention of paper-making technique.
sentences.chinese: 蔡伦对人类最大的贡献是发明了纤维纸及其造纸术。

sentences.english: It is widely accepted that paper was invented by Cai Lun in the Eastern Han.
sentences.chinese: 普遍认为纸由蔡伦在东汉时期发明。

sentences.english: Ts'ai Lun, a Chinese court official, is credited with the invention of paper.
sentences.chinese: 人们公认是中国的一位宫廷官司员蔡伦发明了纸。

definition: Emperor Ling of Han (156-189), reigned from 168 to 189
Ban Gu (32-92), Eastern Han dynasty historian, wrote the Dynastic History of Western Han 漢書|汉书
Emperor Wen of Han (202-157 BC), fourth Han emperor, personal name Liu Heng 劉恆|刘恒[Liu2 Heng2], reigned 180-157 BC
Emperor Wu of the Han dynasty (141-87 BC)
Emperor Xian of Han (181-234), the final Han emperor, set up by Dong Zhuo 董卓, reigned 189-220, forced to abdicate 220 by Cao Pi 曹丕
Sima Qian (145-86 BC), Han Dynasty historian, author of Records of the Grand Historian 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4], known as the father of Chinese historiography
Liu Heng (202-157 BC), the fourth Han emperor Han Wendi, reigned 180-157 BC
Yuan Emperor, reign name of Han Dynasty emperor Liu Shi 劉奭|刘奭[Liu2 Shi4], (74-33 BC), reigned 48-33 BC
grand scribe (official position in many Chinese states up to the Han)
Sima Yan (236-290), founding emperor of Jin dynasty 晋 after the Three Kingdoms period, reigned 265-290 as Emperor Wu of Jin 晉武帝
Li Si (c. 280-208 BC), Legalist philosopher, calligrapher and prime minister of Qin kingdom and Qin dynasty from 246 to 208 BC
